markdownRemark.html:
The computation pattern in training a convolutional network is very similar to matrix multiplication: it is both compute intensive and highly parallel.

convolution == 2d dot product ? == unrolled 1d dot product == matrix multiplication

it is pretty fun to think about, that everything we know in life decomposes to matrix multiplication, which we discussed in an earlier post (matrix multiplication is parallel) .. it is just lucky to have an official name. Now thinking about it - convolution is just a 2d dot product - can we all have a vote to call convolution matrix dot product? If we call an operation between two matrices that does a multiplication followed by summation through collapsing one dimension matrix "multiplication" - we should really call an operation between two matrices that does a dot product followed by summation through collapsing one dimension matrix "dot product" - it's only fair?! Do I sound crazy?
